title: Kuoni offers free holiday to England football star
text:
Kuoni offers free holiday to England football star 3 July 2015 Save 
Kuoni is hoping to cheer-up England women’s footballer Laura Bassett with the offer of a free holiday to the Caribbean. 
The Notts County player unluckily deflected in a cross against Japan in the World Cup semi-final as England lost 2-1. 
“Kuoni has contacted Laura to offer her a free trip to the Caribbean in recognition both of her efforts and the healing power of a holiday because we agree with her England coach who said ‘wherever Laura goes, she will be a hero,” said Kuoni’s managing director Derek Jones. 
“The whole team has done brilliantly to get this far and what an amazing achievement to get to the semi-final, but Laura has clearly been left feeling completely heartbroken this morning.” 
“Holidays are a time when people reflect, wind down and plan for the future so time away could be just what she needs right now. It’s about taking time out, relaxing and then hopefully getting her energy and focus back to returns to the game stronger than ever.” 
Kuoni has offered seven nights in the Caribbean for Laura plus travelling companion and will cover flights, hotel and expenses for a week at a time to suit her.
